content.raw: combine onto same line
content.html: combine onto same line

content.raw: Why is it necessary for this to be a list? Better to have it changed to an iterator \(not an “iterable”--which would include anything that an iterator can be made from like a list\).
content.html: Why is it necessary for this to be a list? Better to have it changed to an iterator (not an “iterable”--which would include anything that an iterator can be made from like a list).

content.raw: what?
content.html: what?

content.raw: Running into DRY \(don’t repeat yourself\) here. There is a lot of repeated code between `_add_track_continuous()` and `add_track_continuous()`. Please refactor.
content.html: Running into DRY (don’t repeat yourself) here. There is a lot of repeated code between _add_track_continuous() and add_track_continuous(). Please refactor.

content.raw: Also: repetitive with `tracknames_continuous()`
content.html: Also: repetitive with tracknames_continuous()

content.raw: Remove
content.html: Remove

content.raw:
1. Use something more descriptive than `x`
2. I don’t think you need `tolist()` anymore as you’re making this into a list yourself
3. What are you using to decode? You did not specify `latin-1`. Danger ahead.

‌
content.html:
1. Use something more descriptive than x
  2. I don’t think you need tolist() anymore as you’re making this into a list yourself
  3. What are you using to decode? You did not specify latin-1. Danger ahead.

‌

content.raw: Change to `viewitems` and import from `six` at top. In general switch dict `iter` to `view` unless there is a good reason.
content.html: Change to viewitems and import from six at top. In general switch dict iter to view unless there is a good reason.

content.raw: The first part of this doesn’t make sense. I’d leave the second part out.
content.html: The first part of this doesn’t make sense. I’d leave the second part out.

content.raw: In what cases will there be no `tokenize.detect_encoding`?
content.html: In what cases will there be no tokenize.detect_encoding?

content.raw: Please use double-quotes as is the convention with the rest of the code.
content.html: Please use double-quotes as is the convention with the rest of the code.

content.raw:
Replace comment and fill in XXX:

    Monkey patches tokenize.detect_encoding() to always return (“latin-1”, []), since default (“utf8", []) is incorrect
    detect_encoding() is used by distutils.XXX()

Needs more on why it is necessary to do this. Where does it matter that `”latin-1”` is used instead of `“utf8”`?
content.html:
Replace comment and fill in XXX:

Monkey patches tokenize.detect_encoding() to always return (“latin-1”, []), since default (“utf8", []) is incorrect
detect_encoding() is used by distutils.XXX()

Needs more on why it is necessary to do this. Where does it matter that ”latin-1” is used instead of “utf8”?

content.raw: What is this for and why isn’t it in both branches?
content.html: What is this for and why isn’t it in both branches?

content.raw: Change uses of `pip` to `python -m pip`
content.html: Change uses of pip to python -m pip

content.raw: If this is to create the `genomedata-test` environment I think that should be named somewhere. If there’s no official name in a Dockerfile use a comment
content.html: If this is to create the genomedata-test environment I think that should be named somewhere. If there’s no official name in a Dockerfile use a comment

content.raw: @ericr86 Can you make a `hoffmanlab` group instead?
content.html: @ericr86 Can you make a hoffmanlab group instead?

content.raw: Is the `python` package guaranteed to be Python 2 or can they someday switch it to Python 3?
content.html: Is the python package guaranteed to be Python 2 or can they someday switch it to Python 3?

content.raw:
I assume you intend this to be run on python2. Why is it not necessary for python3?  
  
Instead of \`pip install\`, I recommend \`python2 -m pip install\` to avoid ambiguity
content.html:
I assume you intend this to be run on python2. Why is it not necessary for python3?

Instead of `pip install`, I recommend `python2 -m pip install` to avoid ambiguity

content.raw: If you are installing from an Ubuntu package, these environment variables should not be necessary. Are they?
content.html: If you are installing from an Ubuntu package, these environment variables should not be necessary. Are they?

content.raw: Yes
content.html: Yes

content.raw: @ericr86 Is this ready for me now?
content.html: @ericr86 Is this ready for me now?
